He's not. At least, not in his mind. You hate us, don't you?
Of course. Animals are the enemy.
You want to see us all die.
It is only a matter of time.
Come on, Hargreaves, we've got to lock him away.
Scorby, he's ill! Leave him alone.
Scorby, they're moving. The plants, they're moving!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Greenery starts to spread over the walkway behind them. Meanwhile, a UNIT sergeant opens the main gates and the Daimler drives through. Back in the greenhouse, Sarah, Hargreaves and Scorby are being smothered by plants while Chase sits and smiles.

Dialogue.Line: Don't resist us, Scorby. You must die. All plant eaters must die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The cries of the trapped people can be heard as the Doctor and Sergeant run along outside the building with two large bottles of liquid and spraying equipment.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, Sergeant.
How do we get in? It's all boarded up.
Break in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They come to a small wooden door.

Dialogue.Line: One, two, three.
Sergeant!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor starts spraying the foliage covering Sarah and it stops moving.

Dialogue.Line: Stop it! Stop it, murderers! Stop it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chase struggles with Henderson, who easily pushes him away.

Dialogue.Line: You'll pay for this, animal fiends!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chase leaves. The Doctor pulls dead foliage off Sarah and helps her to her feet.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Scorby gets out too.

Dialogue.Line: This one's dead, Doctor.
Come on, let's get out of here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They leave Hargreaves in the plants.

Dialogue.Line: The doors.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They shut the doors and pull filing cabinets across in front of them.

Dialogue.Line: How do you feel?
I feel like I've been dragged through a hedge backwards.
What is that stuff?
Latest military defoliant. Still on the secret list. Pity we've used it all.
Come on, we've got to get every plant out of this place and dump it outside.
What for, Doctor?
They're the eyes and ears of the Krynoid.
We'd better keep an eye open for that lunatic Chase.
Good idea.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Major Beresford leads a squad into the area.

Dialogue.Line: Laser, quick. Let him have it. Fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Our heroes see the flash of coherent light against the Krynoid's 'head'.

Dialogue.Line: The Major!
And another. Fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Krynoid staggers and moves away.

Dialogue.Line: The other door. Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They run around the side of the courtyard, behind the Krynoid, and get in through a small door. Chase hears it slam shut.

Dialogue.Line: Hit it square in the chest. Fire! Fire! Fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Krynoid staggers.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The laser squad retreats.
The greenhouse plants are up against the connecting door.

Dialogue.Line: We've got to find Chase before he has another attack of megalomania. Krynoid on the outside, a madman lurking inside, not a happy situation.
Do you think he's counting on the Krynoid sparing him, if, well, if he sacrifices us?
Well, Major Beresford did do his best, even if it was like using a peashooter
Shush, shush, shush. I think we've been wrong about Chase up till now.
What are you on about?
Will you just shut up a minute, please? You said Chase went outside and actually took photographs of the Krynoid, and came in apparently unharmed. Unharmed?
You mean he's actually infected?
Or possessed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: UNIT are still beating a hasty retreat.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, quick, come on!
You and Henderson take that corridor. Sarah and I will go this way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They all leave. Chase steps out of hiding and goes into
Where he looks at the defoliant tanks on the bench.

Dialogue.Line: Filth.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then he goes to the music sound system which is on the filing cabinets in front of the greenhouse doors and smashes it.

Dialogue.Line: (sotto) Doctor, maybe he's not in the house.
I doubt that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He opens a door to be confronted by a wall of foliage. He closes it again as Henderson comes up.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, there's creeper breaking through into the corridor.
Where's Scorby?
He's back in the main lab.
Come on, let's join him there.
What happened?
We've had to pull back. The laser's hopeless against it.
And you haven't made contact with the Doctor?
No, not yet, but I'm going to try and get through with a couple of men.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Krynoid pushes a tentacle through a window and flails around inside briefly.

Dialogue.Line: It's like we're under siege.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A corner of the ceiling is pushed in. Henderson gives his rifle to the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Here, do your best. I'll go and see if I can get some more timber.
Yes, you go and do that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gives the rifle to Scorby. In the compost room, Chase hears Henderson ripping out planks nearby, and picks up a large spanner. He goes and hits the soldier over the head then drags him away. The Krynoid is pushing in a corner of the building. Scorby finishes nailing a plank over the broken window.

Dialogue.Line: It's trying its luck on the east wing now. I still say we make a break for it.
Oh Scorby, just think about what we're up against. Everything that grows in the ground is your enemy. You wouldn't get far.
So what are we supposed to do? Wait here until the Krynoid reduces this place to rubble?
Don't be so negative. Major Beresford's going to come up with something.

Oh yeah. That laser gun was useless, wasn't it. Look, I've never relied on anybody, just myself. I've always got myself out of trouble. Africa, the Middle East, you name it. I've not been a mercenary for nothing. I'm a survivor, right?
Hmm? Scorby, bullets and bombs aren't the answer to everything.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The room shakes and more ceiling plaster comes down.

Dialogue.Line: What are we going to do?
Oh, just shut up, will you? We're all in the same boat.
And where's your precious Beresford? I suppose he's dropped everything and run, has he?
No more than you would, Scorby.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chase has tied up the unconscious Henderson and loaded him into the compost machine. He switches it on.

Dialogue.Line: (looking out of the window.) It's coming back this way, Doctor. Any hope yet?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is repairing the sound system.

Dialogue.Line: Oh yes. Chase didn't do any irreparable damage. I think I can fix this.
Well done.

Oh yeah. Well done Doctor. Why are you bothering? It's obvious your army friends have scarpered. I'd have done the same if I'd been out there. We're as dead as mutton, you realise? RIP. It's ridiculous, isn't it.
Stop feeling sorry for yourself, Scorby. It'll become a habit.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The room shakes again. Scorby runs to a small outside door and moves the filing cabinet aside to open it.

Dialogue.Line: No, Scorby, don't! Don't go, Scorby, you won't make it!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Scorby plunges into the vegetation beyond the door. Sarah and the Doctor push the door shut. Scorby makes it through and runs out into the grounds, where he stumbles into a dew pond. The pondweed rises up and pulls him under. Meanwhile, Beresford and his men make their way to an old stone terrace, where they have a clear view of the Krynoid which is now so big it is practically smothering the old house.
A loud drumming noise starts up.

Dialogue.Line: What's that?
Probably the plants have got into the humidity system.
Well, that means the water could boil up and blow suddenly.
It's possible.
Oh, great. That's all we need. A scalding shower.
Ah. Henderson. Sergeant Henderson?
He's not back yet.
You go and get him.
Right.
Tell him I need Beresford's wavelength.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah finds the planks lying on the floor.

Dialogue.Line: Sergeant? Sergeant? Sergeant?
Sergeant? Sergeant?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chase closes the door behind her.

Dialogue.Line: The sergeant's no longer with us. He's in the garden. He's part of the garden.
That's very clever of you.

Don't humour me, Miss Smith. We're helping the plant world, the sergeant and I. In different ways, of course. I've become part of a life that I've always admired for its beauty, colours, sensitivity. I have the Krynoid to thank, as it thanks me for its opportunity to exist here on Earth. Soon the Krynoids will dominate everywhere, and your foul species will disappear.
And you'll all flower happily ever after.
You and your kind are nothing but parasites. You're dependant upon us for the air you breathe and the food you eat. We have only one use for you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Beresford speaks into his R/T.

Dialogue.Line: This is Scorpio section. I say again, this is Scorpio section. Are you receiving me? Over.
Hello, Beresford, this is the Doctor. I can hear you. Over.
Great. What's your situation, Doctor?
Desperate. We're trapped. What action are you taking against the Krynoid?
The laser had no effect. Frankly, we're stuck for an answer.
Listen, Beresford. By my reckoning you've got about before the Krynoid reaches the point of primary germination.
What's he mean?
Give me that. Doctor, Thackeray here. What do you mean by primary germination?
I mean the Krynoid is about to eject hundreds of embryo pods. The whole planet will be doomed.
How can we stop it?
There's only one way, Sir Colin. A low level attack by aircraft with high explosives.
But that'll mean destroying the house too. What about you and the others?
Never mind us. Order that attack, it's your only chance. Out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes in search of Sarah.

Dialogue.Line: I'll be with you in figures three minutes. Over.
Roger, Red Leader. Out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Beresford goes to Thackeray.

Dialogue.Line: Well, the planes are on their way. Three minutes.
Is there no way we can get them out?
Not a chance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As a flight of five jets head towards their target, Chase is trussing up an unconscious Sarah in the compost machine. Then he switches it on and stand backs to watch. Sarah wakes up and the Doctor bursts in. Chase briefly struggles with him but is easily pushed away. The Doctor switches off the machine and jumps into the hopper to untie Sarah. He lifts her out as Chase switches the machine on again. Chase grabs the Doctor and is pulled inside the hopper as he wrestles with him.

Dialogue.Line: Quick, Sarah, the button. The button!
I can't

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor climbs out of the hopper but Chase hands on to one arm. Sarah still has her hands tied behind her as she hops up and down trying to reach the control panel. Finally, Chase's gloves hands slide off the Doctor's sleeve and he goes into the shredder with a scream. The Doctor unties Sarah properly.

Dialogue.Line: Sarah, I tried to save him. He was trying to pull me in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah sobs and they leave the grisly room.
Two jets fly overhead at low level.

Dialogue.Line: That was a sighting run. Scorpio section to Red Leader. Over.
Red Leader section. We see your target. We're turning to attack now. Over.
Understood. Good luck. Out.
Still no sign of the Doctor.
Afraid not.
(unintelligible) again. Let's turn it into chop suey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Another door to the outside is blocked by foliage.

Dialogue.Line: Where do we go? We've a Krynoid outside, steam inside, bombs overhead.
Steam. Steam!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes to a set of pipes in the wall and starts to undo one of them.

Dialogue.Line: Stand by that door, Sarah.
Right.
When I say. Come on, come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He unfastens a pipe, puts his hat over the end as he turns it towards the doorway, then

Dialogue.Line: Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah opens the door, the Doctor takes his hat off the pipe and hot steam gushes at the plants outside. They stop moving.

Dialogue.Line: Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Sarah fight their way through the unhappy foliage to an area of felled trees. They take cover behind a large log as the RAF begin their attack run. The first strike takes out part of the house, the second hits the Krynoid. So does the third, and lumps of green fly everywhere, then the whole building explodes. Historic property and alien plant burn up in the intense fire.

Dialogue.Line: Well, Doctor, do you think we've heard the last of the Krynoid?
Sir Colin, the Intergalactic Floral Society, of which quite naturally I'm the President, finds Krynoids a difficult subject to study. Their researchers tend to disappear.
Hmm, I can imagine. A case of one veg and no meat.
Very neat, Miss Smith.
Sorry about that.
And talking of societies, Doctor, the Royal Horticultural Society's got wind of this affair. They'd rather like you to address one of their meetings.
Really? When?
I think they suggested the fifteenth.
Fifteenth, fifteenth. No, impossible. I'm fully booked for the next two centuries, but any time after that.
Doctor, I don't know when you're being serious.
I know just how you feel, Sir Colin.
Have you ever heard of Cassiopeia?
Animal, vegetable or mineral?
It's a good place for a holiday. We need a break. Come on.
Oh, great!
Sir Colin, do you fancy a little excursion?
I'd be delighted, but my wife's expecting me home for tea.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis materialises in a white landscape. Sarah runs out in swimming costume and carrying a beach ball then suddenly stops.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, this isn't Cassiopeia.
It's Antarctica.
We're back where we started!
Yes.
We won't get a suntan here.
No.
You forgot to cancel the coordinate programme, didn't you.
Yes.
Shall we try again?
Yes. Just a minute.
What?
Have we been here before, or
Are we yet to come?
